description:
Camden Inspire: Green Loop Takeover is one-day festival taking place in Camden on Saturday 20th September that challenges our obsession with the “new”. 

Join Camden’s makers, artists & designers for hands-on workshops, upcycling, talks, pop-up cinema and panel discussions.

events.name: Camden Inspire
events.notes: Various events on the day - see https://www.camdeninspire.com/ to book

factsheet.heading: Camden Inspire: Green Loop Takeover
paragraphs: Camden Inspire: Green Loop Takeover is a day of community and creative action around climate. Bringing together dozens of organisations, artists, designers, makers, chefs, activists and musicians, the full day of activities explores reuse, zero waste and imagines bold new creative ways of living with less.

Featuring collaborations with local organisations The British Library, Camden Roundhouse, Rochester Square Garden and HvH Arts, the festival will also feature workshops and activities with creative designers: Dotty by Design, Things Matter CIC, Are you Mad?, The Fixing Factory and aforementioned community meal by Garden of Afruika.

There is also UnBroken, a special exhibition of remade furniture as design pieces created by a range of established and emerging talents from London’s world class designer scene, they include: Pearson Lloyd, MUF architecture, Charlie Boyden, 2LG Studio, Francesco Feliziani, Sebastian Bergne, Jaclyn Pappalardo and Andre Kong.

location.address: Camden Collective, Auction Rooms, 5-7 Buck St, NW1 8NJ

name: Camden Inspire: Green Loop Takeover
